t: Psalm 139
To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
O*p Lord,*s thou hast searched me, and known me.
Thou*p knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
Thou*p compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
For*p there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O Lord,*s thou knowest it altogether.
Thou*p hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
Such*p knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
Whither*p shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
If*p I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
If*p I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
Even*p there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
If*p I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
Yea,*p the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
For*p thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.
I*p will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
My*p substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
Thine*p eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
How*p precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
If*p I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
Surely*p thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
For*p they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
Do*p not I hate them, O Lord,*s that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
I*p hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
Search*p me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
And*p see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
